indications: Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine Injection is indicated in adult and pediatric patients for the production of local or regional anesthesia or analgesia for surgery, dental, and oral surgery procedures, diagnostic and therapeutic procedures, and for obstetrical procedures. Specific concentrations and presentations of Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine Injection are recommended for each type of block indicated to produce local or regional anesthesia or analgesia [see Dosage and Administration (2.2)].
contraindications: See Full Prescribing Information for recommended dosages and administration information for adult and pediatric patients ( 2 )
warningsAndPrecautions:
Do not autoclave.
                  
                     Storage: All solutions should be stored at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C to 30°C (59°F to 86°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature]. Protect from light. For single-dose vials and ampules: Discard unused portion.
                  For Epidural test dose, Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine Injection, USP 1:200,000 is a clear, colorless to slightly yellow solution available as:

adverseReactions: Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine Injections are contraindicated in patients with a known hypersensitivity to lidocaine or to any local anesthetics of the amide-type or to other components of Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine Injections.
name: Lidocaine Hydrochloride and Epinephrine
